Procedure: setState_SP
Error:   no convergence. dt = 0.000219057

I feel like my research has become a game of roulette!  I am using Cantera  
 from within Matlab, where I solve systems of compressors and turbines.  It  
works great most of the time!  However when my code asks Cantera to  
setState_SP (entropy and Pressure) or set_State_HP and this state fall  
sufficiently close to 1000K, Cantera crashes.  I know I could fudge my  
quarry in the hopes I donâ€™t land on a 1000K condition but I would rather  
know my code (and Cantera) are rock stable.

I believe this is happening because of the NASA polynomials switching  
coefficients at 1000K, and while the polynomials are close to each other,  
the setState function requires 10^-8 accuracy (way more than I require).

I am hoping someone else has solved this problem or can offer assistance.   
My current thought is to find the function(s) where the polynomial  
coefficients are chosen for the appropriate temperature range.   Then add  
a case such that between T = 999 and 1001 a new polynomial will be  
interpolated and used for the subsequent thermo calculations.   
Unfortunately I have yet to find which functions these are and deduce if  
this may really work/help?

Your help will be greatly appreciated,
Winston Burbank
ftwsb@...
